name: Irish Seal Sanctuary
memberOrga: Charity with no members but a Board of Directors of circa 8 people and a wide network of Volunteers
goal:
The Irish Seal Sanctuary is a professionally run wildlife hospital, rescue and rehabilitation facility. We are a registered charity and are sustained entirely by voluntary effort and donations from the public.
We strive for sustainability in the use of marine resources for all users.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Education, Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Regional Policy, Youth
euInitiatives: Working on common fisheries policy and sustainable fisheries in the North Western Waters Advisory Council. Also member of the Irish North East and the West FLAG.
